intro: Nardurus lachenalii subsp. halleri, commonly known as the Haller's nardus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of many grass species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and an indicator of specific ecological conditions.
